section.name: Server Tasks
section.p: The following tasks exist for running Ant server on one machine, and calling that server from another (or possibly the same) machine, to execute tasks.

subsection.name: AntServer
subsection.p: Starts an Ant server in current process. This server will wait for client connections, and when received, it will execute the commands that the client has sent. NOTE: This is a blocking call, and this task will not return until someone sends the server a shutdown command.

tr.td: The port on which the server will listen.

subsection.name: RemoteAnt
subsection.p: Sends command requests to a running instance of an AntServer which was started using the antserver task. These commands are executed in the space of the server, and therefore have no access to any variables or references in the currently executing project.

tr.td: The machine name on which the server is running.
The port on which the server is listening.
Should we execute all commands, regardless of whether or not one of them fails. If false, as soon as a failure is encountered, we will stop execution.
If any of the sent commands encounters a build failure on the server, should we fail this task.

subsection.p: The commands to send are represented as nested elements as described below

Runs a target which is contained in the same buildfile where the antserver task was called. This element may contain nested property elements for sending parameters to the target, and nested reference elements for sending references to the target.

tr.td: The name of the target to run.

subsection.p: Runs a target in an arbitrary buildfile on the machine where the antserver task was called. If a relative pathname is given, then the path of the buildfile is relative to the base directory of the project where the antserver task was called. This element may contain nested property elements for sending text parameters to the target, and nested reference elements for sending references to the target.

tr.td: The path of the ant file to run (if relative, then the filename is computed relative to the buildfile of the server task's base directory
No. Defaults to "build.xml" in the directory where the buildfile is to execute (specified by the dir attribute)
The name of the target to run.
No. Defaults to the default target of the specified antfile.

the directory to use as a basedir for the new Ant project. Defaults to the server project's basedir, unless inheritall has been set to false, in which case it doesn't have a default value. This will override the basedir setting of the called project.
Should the target task inherit all of the server's properties. This is equivalent to the flag of the same name on the ant task.
Should the target task inherit all of the server's references. This is equivalent to the flag of the same name on the ant task.

subsection.p: Instructs the antserver task to shut itself down. Control will return to the Ant engine and will procede as necessary
Sends a file from the client to the server

tr.td: The path of the file to send.
The filename where the file is to be stored on the server, if a relative path, then it is stored relative to the server project's base directory.

The directory where the file is to be stored on the server, if a relative path, then it is stored relative to the server project's base directory. The name of the file will be the same name as the source file

subsection.name: Example:
subsection.source: <remoteant machine="localhost" port="12345"> <runtarget target="execute.build"> <property name="build.type" value="full"/> </runtarget> <runant dir="tests" target="build.tests"> <property name="build.type" value="full"/> <reference refid="my.ref" torefid="inherited.ref"/> </runant> </remoteant>
subsection.p: would be the equivalent of running the following directly on the server machine, from within the same buildfile where the antserver task was run
subsection.source: <antcall target="execute.build"> <param name="build.type" value="full"/> </antcall> <ant dir="tests"> <property name="build.type" value="full"/> <reference refid="my.ref" torefid="inherited.ref"/> </ant>
